bug.author: foufaster
bug.summary: Type error in French with "je", "moi" and other words.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
Spacy yields a fatal error while dealing with some French words like "je", and "moi". import spacy nlp = spacy.load("fr") nlp("Je suis chez moi") <denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.0.18 Platform: Linux-4.4.0-141-generic-x86_64-with-debian-stretch-sid Python version: 3.7.2 Models: fr
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: ubuntu 16.4 Python Version Used: 3.7.2 Environment Information: atomicwrites==1.2.1 attrs==18.2.0 certifi==2018.11.29 chardet==3.0.4 cymem==2.0.2 Cython==0.27.3 cytoolz==0.9.0.1 dill==0.2.8.2 idna==2.8 mock==2.0.0 more-itertools==5.0.0 msgpack==0.5.6 msgpack-numpy==0.4.3.2 murmurhash==1.0.1 numpy==1.16.0 pathlib==1.0.1 pbr==5.1.1 plac==0.9.6 pluggy==0.8.1 preshed==2.0.1 py==1.7.0 pytest==4.0.2 regex==2018.1.10 requests==2.21.0 six==1.12.0 spacy==2.0.18 thinc==6.12.1 toolz==0.9.0 tqdm==4.29.1 ujson==1.35 urllib3==1.24.1 wrapt==1.10.11

comments.comment:
Spacy yields a fatal error while dealing with some French words like "je", and "moi".
What exactly is the error? And could you run python -m spacy validate and share the result?

Installed models (spaCy v2.0.18) /home/****/spaCy/spacy TYPE NAME MODEL VERSION link fr fr_core_news_sm 2.0.0 âœ”
The error is: File "", line 1, in
File "/home/****/spaCy/spacy/language.py", line 346, in call doc = proc(doc) File "pipeline.pyx", line 427, in spacy.pipeline.Tagger.call File "pipeline.pyx", line 463, in spacy.pipeline.Tagger.set_annotations File "morphology.pyx", line 111, in spacy.morphology.Morphology.assign_tag_id File "morphology.pyx", line 182, in spacy.morphology.Morphology.lemmatize TypeError: Expected unicode, got tuple
I actually fixed the error locally. I'm waiting for my contribution to be accepted.
Just merged your PR with the contributor agreement â€“ so feel free to submit your suggestion for the fix ðŸ™‚
Seems to be fixed on develop, so you should be able to use the fix if you install from spacy-nightly. Thanks again for the report!
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
